monogr.title: The generall historie of Virginia, New-England, and the Summer Isles : with the names of the adventurers, planters, and governours from their first beginning. an⁰: 1584. to this present 1624. With the procedings of those severall colonies and the accidents that befell them in all their journyes and discoveries. Also the maps and descriptions of all those countryes, their commodities, people, government, customes, and religion yet knowne. Divided into sixe bookes. By Captaine Iohn Smith sometymes governour in those countryes & admirall of New England
monogr.author: Smith, John

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: To that worthy and generous Gentleman, my very good friend, Captaine Smith.
div.l: MAy Fate thy Proiect prosper, that thy name
May be eternized with liuing fame:
Though foule Detraction Honour would peruert,
And Enuie euer waits vpon desert:
In spight of Pelias, when his hate lies cold,
Returne as Iason with a fleece of gold.
Then after-ages shall record thy praise,
That a New-England to this Ile didst raise:
And when thou di'st (as all that liue must die)
Thy fame liue here; thou, with Eternity.
